title: TypeScript vs JavaScript: Why Every Dev Should Switch
description: Discover how TypeScript helps you catch errors during development before they hit production.
mainPoints: Better Autocomplete and Documentation in VS Code
Interfaces and Types for scalable codebases
conclusion: TypeScript might have a learning curve, but it saves hours of debugging in the long run.

title: Top ES6+ Features Every Modern Developer Needs
description: JavaScript has evolved. Master Arrow Functions, Destructuring, and Template Literals.
mainPoints: Destructuring objects and arrays for cleaner code
The power of the Spread and Rest operators
Async/Await for handling asynchronous operations cleanly
conclusion: Modern JS syntax makes your code more readable and shorter to write.

title: The Power of Semantic HTML5 for SEO
description: Why using <div> for everything is a bad idea and how semantic tags help SEO.
mainPoints: How Accessibility (A11y) improves with proper HTML
conclusion: Clean HTML is the foundation of a high-ranking and accessible website.

title: A Professional GitHub Workflow for Solo Developers
description: Master Git branching, commits, and pull requests to manage your code like a pro.
mainPoints: Meaningful commit messages using Conventional Commits
How to resolve Merge Conflicts without panicking
conclusion: Git is not just for backup; it is a time machine for your code.

title: How React Virtual DOM Actually Works
description: Understanding the magic behind React's speed and how it updates the UI efficiently.
mainPoints: Difference between Real DOM and Virtual DOM
How Batch Updates reduce browser workload
conclusion: Virtual DOM is why React feels so snappy even with complex data changes.

title: Node.js Event Loop: Why it is Non-Blocking?
description: A deep dive into how Node.js handles thousands of requests using a single thread.
mainPoints: What happens in the Callback Queue
conclusion: Mastering the event loop is the key to writing high-performance Node.js APIs.

title: MongoDB vs SQL: When to choose NoSQL?
description: Comparing Document-based storage with Relational tables for modern web apps.
conclusion: MongoDB is perfect for fast-paced development where data structures evolve quickly.

title: Why I switched to Tailwind CSS for UI Design
description: Utility-first CSS is not just a trend; it's a faster way to build custom interfaces.
mainPoints: Building responsive designs in half the time
conclusion: Tailwind keeps your bundle small and your development speed high.

title: REST API Design: 5 Best Practices
description: How to design clean, scalable, and easy-to-use APIs for your frontend.
mainPoints: Using proper HTTP Verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
conclusion: A well-designed API is a joy to work with for any frontend developer.

title: State Management with Redux Toolkit (RTK)
description: Why Redux Toolkit is the industry standard for managing global state in large scale apps.
mainPoints: Why RTK is better than old 'Vanilla' Redux
conclusion: RTK removes the 'boilerplate' and makes Redux predictable and easy to use.

title: Mobile-First Design: Building for Every Screen
description: A deep dive into Flexbox, Grid, and Media Queries for a seamless user experience.
mainPoints: Testing on real devices using Chrome DevTools
conclusion: A responsive site isn't a luxury; it's a requirement in 2026.

title: Mastering NPM: Beyond just 'npm install'
description: How to manage dependencies, scripts, and versions in your package.json file.
conclusion: Knowing your tools makes you a more efficient and safe developer.

title: Deployment Strategies: Taking Your App Live
description: Choosing the right platform for your Frontend and Backend services.
mainPoints: Setting up Environment Variables (ENV) for security
conclusion: Proper deployment is just as important as writing the code itself.

title: Writing Clean Code: The SOLID Principles
description: Code is read more often than it is written. Learn how to make it readable.
conclusion: Clean code is a gift you give to your future self and your team.
